values:
Dear Kababayan, 

Typhoon Ondoy (international name: Ketsana) has greatly affected Luzon. 

About 280,000 people have been displaced and 51 were killed as of this writing. (http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/nation/view/20090927-227130/51-dead-280000-displaced-by-Ondoy)

Around 41,000 people are now in 92evacuation centers.
AFFECTED AREAS:
Aurora, Quirino
Nueva Vizacaya
Nueva Ecija
Pangasinan
Pampanga
Tarlac
Zambales
Bulacan,
Rizal (CAINTA)
Quezon
Isabela                                                         
Mt. Province
Benguet
Ifugao
La Union
Ilocos Sur
Cavite
Mindoro Oriental
Mindoro Occidental
Batangas
Marinduque
Camarines Norte
and Metro Manila (PASIG, MARIKINA, STA.MESA)

WE can HELP. 
WE can be HEROES in our own little ways. 

BAYANIHAN!


Check PHOTOS of affected people in MARIKINA here:http://www.flickr.com/photos/rembcc/3957566392/in/set-72157622458559722/

PHOTOS above by Izah. Taken at Vito Cruz, manila.

FROM TXTPower: (http://www.txtpower.org/2009/09/philippines-help-typhoon-victims-in-luzon-philippines/)

TXTPower urges its members, supporters and friends abroad to makedonations via Paypal. You may also donate via SmartMoney (5577-5144-1866-7103) or GCash 0917-9751092.  All donations coursed through TXTPower will be sent to the Philippine National Red Cross.

The Philippine Red Cross is accepting MONETARY and IN KIND DONATIONS. 
(http://www.redcross.org.ph/Site/PNRC/wtd.aspx)

1.  CASH or CHECK
Please send cash or check donations to the PNRC National Headquarters in Manila. Checks should be made payable to The Philippine National Red Cross.  We can also arrange for donation pick-up.

2.  BANK DEPOSIT
Account Name:  The Phil. Nat’l. Red Cross 

    METROBANK
    Port Area Branch
    Peso Acct.: 151-3-041-63122-8
    Dollar Acct.: 151-2-151-00218-2
    Type of Acct. : SAVINGS
    Swift Code: MBTC PH MM 

    BANK OF THE PHIL. ISLANDS
    Port Area Branch
    Peso Acct.:  4991-0010-99
    Type of Account: CURRENT

    BANK OF THE PHIL. ISLANDS
    UN Branch
    Dollar Acct.: 8114-0030-94
    Type of Account: SAVINGS
    Swift Code:  BOPI PH MM
    
For your donations to be properly acknowledged, please fax the bank transaction slip at nos. +63.2.527.0575 or +63.2.404.0979 with your name, address and contact number.



Credit Card                

Please fax the following info to +632.404.09.79 and +632.527.0575:

Name of card member, billing address, contact nos. (phone & mobile), credit card no., expiration date, CCV2/ CVC2 (last three digits at the back of the credit card), billing address, amount to be donated.

For online donations you may also visit our website at www.redcross.org.ph  .

In-Kind Donations            

LOCAL
Please send in-kind local donations to The Philippine National Red Cross – National Headquarters in Manila.  We could also arrange for donation pick-up.

INTERNATIONAL
  1. Send a letter of intent to donate to the PNRC
  2. A letter of acceptance from PNRC shall be sent back to the donor
  3. Immediately after shipping the goods, please send the (a) original Deed of Donation, (b) copy of packing list and (c) original Airway Bill for air shipments or Bill of Lading for sea shipments to The Philippine National Red Cross–National Headquarters c/o Secretary General Corazon Alma de Leon, Bonifacio Drive, Port Area, Manila 2803, Philippines.

The PNRC does not accept rotten, damaged, expired or decayed goods.  Though we appreciate your generosity, the PNRC also discourages donations of old clothes as we have more than enough to go around.

SMS and G-CASH (Globe)        

SMS
text RED<space>AMOUNT  to 2899 (Globe) or 4483 (Smart)

G-CASH
text DONATE<space>AMOUNT<space>4-digit M-PIN<space>REDCROSS to 2882


Most urgent needs

Food items: Rice, noodles, canned goods, sugar, iodized salt, cooking oil, monggo beans and potable water

Medicines: Paracetamol, antibiotics, analgesic, oral rehydration salts, multivitamins and medications to treat diarrheal diseases

Non-food items: Bath soaps, face towels, shampoo, toothbrush, toothpaste, plastic mats, blankets, mosquito nets, jerry cans, water containers, water purification tablets, plastic sheetings, and Laundry soap

Rehabilitation Programs: Shelter materials for house repair

Call Hotline 143 or 527.0000

THE PHILIPPINE NATIONAL RED CROSS
NATIONAL HEADQUARTERS        
Bonifacio Drive, Port Area,            
Manila 2803, Philippines

LAS PINAS/PARANAQUE people: Donations for the victims of Ondoy can be brought to SOUTHVILLE LUXEMBOURGE CAMPUS starting TOMORROW. Please bring water, clothes, ready to eat food, and if you can, money to help our fellow Filipino's who were victims ...of Ondoy to the Public Relations Office.

Together, we can make a difference.

This is what's happening to my city.

 
In other news, Reis has no electricity/water in her condo so I'll ask my parents if she can stay in my place for a week or so since her workplace/school is near my home anyway. Dad wants to go to Rockwell in Buendia where it was FLOODED last night even if there's a storm scheduled to land soon and I'm like wtf? but whatever, yeah.

I hope all the Manilenyos in my list are safe, I'm praying for you guys. No class tomorrow btw. State of calamity still up on Manila and Rizal.

Metro, 23 provinces under state of calamity 
 
By Lira Dalangin-Fernandez
INQUIRER.net
First Posted 17:26:00 09/26/2009

Filed Under: Weather, Disasters (general), Flood

 

MANILA, Philippines—President Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo has declared a state of calamity in Metro Manila and at least 23 provinces severely battered by tropical storm Ondoy, Defense Secretary and National Disaster Coordinating Council (NDCC) chairman Gilbert Teodoro said.

Presiding over a briefing of the NDCC aired live over ANC network, Teodoro said the President has authorized him to make the announcement of the areas under state of calamity to allow their respective local governments to mobilize resources needed in relief and evacuation operations and other assistance.

The Philippine Atmospheric Geophysical Astronomical Services Administration (Pagasa) had said that Saturday's flooding was the worst in 20 years.

Teodoro also said that focus of rescue operations are in Cainta, Marikina and Pasig, which are inundated by floodwaters since Saturday morning.

He said rescue and relief efforts by air would be done by the Philippine Air Force when possible.

Interviewed separately on radio, Teodoro also said that the United States has offered assistance but that the NDCC would still evaluate the help needed from the Americans.

The areas under the state of calamity are Aurora, Quirino, Nueva Vizacaya, Nueva Ecija, Pangasinan, Pampanga, Tarlac, Zambales, Bulacan, Rizal, Quezon, Isabela, Mt. Province, Benguet, Ifugao, La Union, Ilocos Sur, Cavite, Mindoro Oriental, Mindoro Occidental, Batangas, Marinduque, Camarines Norte, and Metro Manila.

 

-taken from the Philippine Daily Inquirer

 Metro Manila is currently under a state of calamity as the non-stop rains have put the city underwater. Taft Avenue (CSB, DLSU) are flooding inside, Intramuros and Luneta are underwater as well; UST I don't want to think about, and 100 reported dead in Katipunan. Ateneo and UP, I assume, are also flooded.

I am currently stranded in Reis' condo in Serendra; was stranded earlier in Glorietta but fortunately Reis said I could stay here for a while. Nearly got stuck in CSB with waist-deep water but was able to take the train to Central, back to EDSA and took the MRT to Glorietta; my driver is currently stranded in Taft. Apparently the flood there is until the bumper of my car. I hope he is safe. There are lots stranded in CSB, some are my friends. I pray, I pray that they are safe. Idk if I can go home tonight seeing as the floods are incredibly high right now and I would rather not have my family go through that danger to pick me up.

Everyone in please be safe. Don't go out; all the highways are clogged with traffic and water. Pasay Rotonda and EDSA went under this morning; the floods in Magallanes reached were over waist-high. Ortigas, Shaw and San Juan are also underwater. Multinational Village in Paranaque is now neck-high. Guys, stay home, keep dry, be safe. Hope your phones have some battery and credits to call loved ones and help hotline. Please be okay.

Hotlines to call:
09178997898 Philippine Natl RED CROSS. (missing/stranded persons); 

RED CROSS OPCEN 5270000/5245787 


Meralco Hotline: 09175592824, 09209292824.
National Disaster Coordinating Council (NDCC) Emergency Numbers:
911-1873, 912-5296, 912-5668, 911-1406, 912-2665, 911-5061.
Helphotlines: 734-2118, 734-2120. Red Cross: 14...3.

Be safe everyone!

Dear Roses,

The Hungarian Versailles Street Team is having a commemorative gathering in honour of Jasmine You. 

To honour him, they will be lighting lilac candles, whether they be in the gathering or in the privacy of their homes. They ask that this become an international affair, and I think it would be nice to participate in this affair to honour our beloved bassist.

This shall take place on Friday, Aug.14, 2009 at 8pm Hungarian time (GMT +1, Paris/Budapest), or Saturday, Aug.15, 2009 at 2am Philippine time. 

Seeing as we can't all be up at 2am, I propose that we light it earlier at around 10pm Friday, and keep it burning through the night. What say you, Roses?

It is the least we can do for Jasmine You, and this can be our send off as well. I hope many participate in it, and take pictures if you can. :)

TOKIO HOTEL WINS
THE MTV VMA'S
BEST NEW ARTIST AWARD


I AM SO FUCKING HAPPY

i just wish I didn't miss the VMAs though... but then I would have totally spazzed out if I saw everything.

CONGRATULATIONS TOKIO HOTEL!! WE ARE SO FUCKING PROUD OF YOU!!!

THEY WON OMFG.

AND ON THE EVE OF GUSTAV'S BIRTHDAY TOO, FUCKING AWESOME!

Words cannot express how happy I am for these boys. The twins are only 19, Gustav is officially 20 today and Georg's 21. They are rather young but they've come so far since they started as Devilish at 13 years old, back in Magdeburg, Germany.

THESE KIDS ARE PRACTICALLY MY AGE!!! I was just looking through their photos as Devilish and when they first started out and now they're all grown up and winning awards and helping heal wounds through music. Kids in France, Poland, Czechoslovakia and the US are now trying to learn German to understand them, and these are the countries that Germany hurt so badly in the (first AND) second world war. It's just one of the cases that proves music can heal and unite hearts all around the world (the other proof being Japanese artists and their popularity in Chinese and Korean cities). It is amazing what music can do, and this shows that anything is possible as long as you work hard, sacrifice and LOVE what you're doing. I am so proud of the boys. They've sacrificed time with their family and friends, a normal teenage life, school, normal friends and a social life for their life of music... but they're not complaining, and I'm sure they're loving every second of it.

The boys never even dreamed of winning the award; they were just so happy to present and to just be there. AND NOW THEY'VE WON!!! They were up against the likes of Miley Cyrus, the Jonas Brothers, Katie Perry and others, but THEY STILL WON!!!!! I AM SO FUCKING PROUD OF THEM!!!!

I am so happy for them and I am just so, so proud that they've come so far. I am so, so, so proud of them. I haven't been in this fandom long but I love them for what they've done and what they can still do. I am so excited to watch them grow even more as a band and as individuals. They're going to start working on their next album soon, and I can't wait to see what they'll put in it. They've worked so hard over the years, and it's paid off a million times over. LOL i teared up when I read it. I have never been so happy for a band in my life!!! ♥

I totally spazzed downstairs to my dad and my tita. They lol'd, but my tita was hella impressed. XDDD

TOKIO HOTEL, Herzliche Glückwünsche zu Gewinn der MTV VMA BEST NEW ARTIST AWARD und WIR LEIBE DICH!♥

Herzliche Glückwünsche zu Gewinn der MTV VMA BEST NEW ARTIST!
Wir sind so stolz auf Sie!!!! ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥

BOYS, WE ARE SO, SO PROUD OF YOU!! ♥ ♥

(Shelley Ritter tama ba mga sinabi ko dyan LOL?)

Alles Gute zum Geburstag, Bill und Tom Kaulitz!! ♥

Bill and Tom Kaulitz, the twins of Tokio Hotel, turn 19 years old today. They were born in Liepzig, East Germany back in 1989, and together they started Tokio Hotel with bassist Georg Listing (21) and Gustav Schäfer (20). They are currently touring the US. o/

Anyway, Happy Birthday to the twins! More success in both personal and Tokio Hotel-related affairs to both of you, and I hope you guys keep growing together as twins/brothers, as a band and as individuals while having more fun along the way~!

Leb' die Sekunde, boys :D
